src:
Advocats i familiars diuen que els detinguts van declarar coaccionats
Un dels presos va admetre haver estat investigant amb explosius

07 Nov 2019, 21:57

Els advocats que defensen els CDR empresonats i els seus familiars resten credibilitat a les seves declaracions davant de l’Audiència Nacional que consten en el sumari del cas, al qual ha tingut accés l’ARA. Segons els vídeos de la causa, un dels investigats, Ferran Jolis, va explicar que hi havia un pla per ocupar el Parlament, tot i que es va descartar. Un altre dels arrestats, Jordi Ros, va admetre que estava “fabricant” termita, però va assegurar que era “un repte” per veure “si es podien arribar a fer explosius” i que mai pensava utilitzar-los. El portaveu dels lletrats d’Alerta Solidària, Xavier Pellicer, subratllava ahir després que transcendís el gruix del sumari que aquestes declaracions es van fer sense garanties i sota coaccions.
Pellicer explicava que dos dels arrestats van declarar sense haver dormit gairebé gens en tres dies i sense haver pogut parlar amb un advocat de confiança -tant Jolis com Ros són els dos únics que anaven amb advocat d’ofici i van declarar-. Per això considera que les declaracions “no han de tenir valor jurídic”. En cas que l’acusació continués, Pellicer afegia, a més, que no hi ha proves que els investigats arribessin a materialitzar els suposats explosius -als escorcolls els van trobar substàncies químiques però no cap tipus d’artefacte- i defensava la legitimitat d’una “ocupació simbòlica” del Parlament com un exercici “del dret de protesta”.
En una conversa amb l’ARA, David Ros, oncle de Jordi Ros, també descarta la validesa de la seva declaració. “Això que ha sortit era esperable, ja que declara sota coaccions i síndrome d’Estocolm, perquè fins i tot parla de la Guàrdia Civil com a companys”. Jordi Ros s’hi refereix principalment al principi de la seva compareixença, en què arriba a lamentar la feina que ha donat als agents, es mostra penedit i parla d’un “tracte exquisit” per part del cos armat. El seu parent denuncia també les condicions en què va declarar. “Es va passar tres dies sense dormir i quatre sense ulleres, amb amenaces directes i a familiars”, explica David Ros, que diu que li van ensenyar una fotografia de la seva dona d’aquell dia en un aeroport i li van dir que la podien detenir.
L’oncle del Jordi també denuncia coaccions durant la detenció a casa del seu germà, on vivia fruit de l’incendi que es va produir al seu pis -situat a la mateixa finca- i que en la declaració admet que va ser manipulant una olla. “Van encanonar amb la pistola el cap del seu germà, i a ell també -diu-. El meu fill, que coneix molt bé el seu cosí, em diu que considera que declara totalment drogat. Això lliga amb el que va dir el Ferran al seu pare”, remarca.
“Destrossat psicològicament”
El David tampoc dona credibilitat a la declaració de Ferran Jolis, l’altre arrestat que va admetre al jutge haver rebut una petició de la germana de l’expresident Carles Puigdemont perquè li instal·lés un sistema per poder-li enviar correus segurs. “Ha explicat que el van destrossar psicològicament i que li van posar alguna cosa a la beguda, perquè molts dies després tenia llacunes i no ho recordava tot”, subratlla, i posa èmfasi en “les bajanades que diu en la declaració”.
També carrega contra la manera en què va ser arrestat. “Al Ferran i la seva dona la Guàrdia Civil els va tenir en nu integral quan van entrar a casa seva i no els van llegir els drets, i no van tenir advocat fins al cap de 25 dies”, lamenta. Així mateix, revela que després de vuit hores d’escorcoll els agents li van dir a la seva dona que signés l’inventari sense llegir-lo. “Ella s’hi va negar, però el Ferran li va respondre que no tenia res a amagar i li va dir que signés i així marxarien”, afirma. El problema és, com apunta l’oncle del Jordi, que “no saben què van signar ni en tenen cap còpia”. Per tot plegat, conclou que, “ateses les circumstàncies, és estrany que només hagin declarat el que han declarat”.




El sumari dels CDR apunta que els detinguts es van plantejar ocupar el Parlament en connivència amb Presidència
text:
Lawyers and relatives say the detainees declared coerced
One of the prisoners admitted to have been investigating explosives

07 Nov 2019, 21:57

The lawyers who defend the imprisoned CDR and their relatives are credible in their statements before the National Court that they appear in the summary of the case, to which the ARA has had access. According to the videos of the case, one of the investigators, Ferran Jolis, explained that there was a plan to occupy Parliament, although it was ruled out. Another of the arrested, Jordi Ros, admitted that he was a termite "manufacturer", but said it was "a challenge" to see "if they could become explosives" and that they never thought of using them. The spokesman for the Alert Solidary Lawyer, Xavier Pellicer, stressed yesterday after the bulk of the summary that these statements were made without guarantees and under coercion.
Pellicer explained that two of the arrested said they had not been able to sleep for almost three days and had not been able to speak with a trusted lawyer - both Jolis and Ros are the only two to go with a lawyer and said. That is why he believes that the statements "must not have legal value". In the event that the prosecution continued, Pellicer further added that there is no evidence that the investigators were able to materialize the alleged explosives - they had found chemical scumps but not any type of device - and argued for the legitimacy of the " a "symbolic occupation" of Parliament as an exercise "of the right of protest."
In a conversation with the ARA, David Ros, uncle of Jordi Ros, also discard the validity of his statement. "What came out was expected, as he says under coercion and the Stockholm syndrome, because he even speaks of the Civil Guard as companions." Jordi Ros refers mainly to the beginning of his appearance, where he regrets the work he has given to the agents, he shows regret and talks about an "exquisite deal" by the armed body. His relative also denounces the conditions in which he declared. "It was spent three days without sleep and four without glasses, with direct and family threats," explains David Ros, who says that they were shown a photograph of his wife at that day at an airport and they told him that they could stop
Jordi's uncle also denounces coercion during the detention at his brother's house, where he was living as a result of the fire that occurred on his floor - located on the same farm - and that in the statement he admits that he was manipulating a pot . "They cheered the gun with his gun, and he too," he says. My son, who knows his cousin very well, tells me that he considers that he is totally drugged. This binds to what Ferran said to his father, "he says.
"Destroyed psychologically"
David also does not give credence to the statement by Ferran Jolis, the other detained who admitted to the judge that he had received a request from the sister of former president Carles Puigdemont to install a system to send him safe mail. "He explained that they were psychologically wrecked and they put something to drink, because many days later he had gaps and he did not remember everything," he emphasizes, and emphasizes "the tears in the statement."
He also charges against the way he was arrested. "Al Ferran and his wife, the Guardia Civil, had them in a nutshell when they entered their house and they did not read the rights, and they did not have a lawyer until after 25 days," he regrets. He also reveals that after eight hours of scorching agents told his wife to sign the inventory without reading it. "She refused but Ferran replied that he had nothing to hide and told him to sign and so they would leave," he says. The problem is, as Jordi's uncle points out, that "they do not know what they signed or have a copy of." As a result, he concludes that, "given the circumstances, it is strange that they have only declared what they have declared."




The CDR summary points out that the detainees were considering taking up Parliament in collusion with the Presidency
